text: <@U6788D83U> Thanks for helping, I need to rewrite the problem since I call this ODE in Turing and consequently the ODE solution is in Dual type which could not be applied to Symmetric().

elements.text: Thanks for helping, I need to rewrite the problem since I call this ODE in Turing and consequently the ODE solution is in Dual type which could not be applied to Symmetric().

text:
What is the issue with Dual numbers and Symmetric?
```using ForwardDiff
using LinearAlgebra
using Distributions
function test(x)
    A = [1.0 x+eps(x);x 1.0]
    MvNormal(A)
    y = det(A)
end
x = 0.0
test(x)
ForwardDiff.derivative(test,x)

function test2(x)
    A = [1.0 x+eps(x);x 1.0]
    A = Symmetric(A)
    MvNormal(A)
    y = det(A)
end
x = 0.0
test2(x)
ForwardDiff.derivative(test2,x)```

elements.text: What is the issue with Dual numbers and Symmetric?

using ForwardDiff
using LinearAlgebra
using Distributions
function test(x)
    A = [1.0 x+eps(x);x 1.0]
    MvNormal(A)
    y = det(A)
end
x = 0.0
test(x)
ForwardDiff.derivative(test,x)

function test2(x)
    A = [1.0 x+eps(x);x 1.0]
    A = Symmetric(A)
    MvNormal(A)
    y = det(A)
end
x = 0.0
test2(x)
ForwardDiff.derivative(test2,x)
